title: A Hat in Time
notes: Performance is bad unless you tweak settings a bit like disable antialiasing or set  it to "FXAA0", limiting draw distance, disabling blur also helps. Audio sliders in settings do not work, and audio sometimes feel weird - when loading level music starts once, plays for a second then starts again. Some abient sounds feel like they're playing at full volume always. Some minor visual glitches in mafia town when it's raining.

title: A Hat In Time
notes: Audio issues solved by installing xact with winetricks.  Heavy stuttering at the start but it went away with time. Minor visual problems.

title: A Hat in Time
notes: Game has a noticeable low framerate (could just be the GPU itself though) without meddling with default graphics. Game ambience too loud while dialog volume too low, volume unchangeable in the options.

title: A Hat in Time
notes: Framerate is fine on low settings, however sound effects from objects in the environment all sound as if they are in close proximity to the player (e.g. you will hear the doggo version of the spaceship theme when you begin the game, as if you were close to the TV)

title: A Hat in Time
notes: Framerate is MUCH worse than on Windows - on Windows, I get stable framerate on Ultra, while on Linux I need to use minimum settings. Occasional stuttering. Some minor audio and visual bugs. Overall, it's playable, but I wouldn't recommend it for the time being.

notes: Requires winetricks/protontricks to install xact to fix sound issues. If the game refuses to start with error R6025 after installing xact, delete steamapps/common/HatinTime/HatinTimeGame/Config/HatinTimeEngine.ini.

notes: It surprisingly works very good. Sound seems sketchy (overblown volume, and sound loops not working correctly) which leads to some occasional stuttering, but it looks very promising. It feels like a Platinum title, in need of a wine tweak

title: A Hat in Time

notes:
After installing xact via Winetricks and setting xaudio2_7 to "native then builtin", the audio and volume sliders work as intended.
Still some graphical problems (some wall-textures in World 2 Act 1 appear white), and it has crashed in World 2 once (got past that instance at a second attempt though, so it appears somewhat random).
title: A Hat in Time

notes: hard to say on this one. Install xact and it seems to work fine but there seems to be something off as well.  Works ok overall I guess
title: A Hat in Time

notes: Game launches fine from a default install, but as others note you must install xact with winetricks to get audio muxing working.  Installing xact broke controller support for me, however, and I needed to install the setup_dumxinputemu.verb (available from its repository on github) to get controller support back.  After those two things, game runs very acceptably on my older machine.  Local co-op even works!
title: A Hat in Time

notes: DO NOT install Xact, ONLY Using winecfg to set xaudio2_7 to Native,Builtin fixes sound issues, everything else works no problems.
title: A Hat in Time

notes: Some minor graphical issues. Controllers not working.
title: A Hat in Time

gpu: NVIDIA Corporation GeForce GTX 1060 with Max-Q Design/PCIe/SSE2
notes: Requires winetricks/protontricks to install xact to fix sound issues. xaudio2_7 override alone did not help on my system. Massive texture issues during rain in the first world (one short level) and minor texture issues in levels in the second world. If the game refuses to start with error R6025, delete steamapps/common/HatinTime/HatinTimeGame/Config/HatinTimeEngine.ini. Deletion can be done via launch options if desired. I played the entire game start to finish, no issues are gamebreaking.
title: A Hat in Time

notes: I had to install xact with protontricks. Otherwise, voices were too soft and background music was too loud. The sound controls in the same would not work properly without xact being installed either. There are issues where the screen goes white (or a large part of it) during the first level on act 3 with the rain.
title: A Hat in Time

notes:
Almost a full playthrough, I'm only missing a few time rifts but I played all acts.

You have to install xact to avoid audio issues (easiest way is through protontricks : install https://github.com/Sirmentio/protontricks and then run `protontricks 253230 xact`).

There is a very minor glitch (white flashes) in one of the early levels, but it doesn't really affect gameplay and that level is only 5 minutes long anyways. The rest of the game renders with no issues.

No problems either with controller support. My Logitech F310 is recognized as a 360 gamepad but whatever, it works.

That game is aaalmooost Gold...but I have to rate it Silver because performance is not as good as it should be, especially in high-polycount areas like Mafia Town. Thankfully there are plenty of graphical options to tweak, and I could to maintain a mostly stable 60 FPS with the game still looking good. But that may not be achievable on older hardware.

Boop !
title: A Hat in Time

notes: Small stuttering, sound crackling.

notes: Sporadically get glitchy character models and white outs. But otherwise it's playable.
title: A Hat in Time

notes:
Solved Audio (dialogue volume) issue with xact (protontricks 253230 xact)
Solved disturbing glitchy white textures (rain in Chapter 1 Act 3 mainly) by switching to the BETA 1.0 version via steam (this is the steam release version of the game, bugs were patched out but no content added afterwards) (right click game -> beta -> v1.0)
Controller (PS3) works out of the box
Performance is satisfactory (Ultra high, 120 FPS)
title: A Hat in Time

notes:
The game has a problem with the audio! To fix this problem you have to use protontricks to install "xcat" and then in winecfg we have to add xaudio2_7 to complete.
In act 3 of chapter 1 sometimes a white screen appears but nothing that hinders much (if it moves a little more it corrects)!
title: A Hat in Time

notes: Game has some minor graphical issues that do not hinder the playability of the game. Audio has issues, but can mostly be fixed with xact, which you can install by using `protontricks 253230 xact` after protontricks (https://github.com/Sirmentio/protontricks) is installed. Performance is as expected.
title: A Hat in Time
